thread.title: 7 Ways to Save Money in Sacramento
thread.title_full: 7 Ways to Save Money in Sacramento

author: Valencia Higuera
title: 7 Ways to Save Money in Sacramento
text:
By Valencia Higuera July 8, 2015 
With its mild climate and local attractions, Sacramento, Calif., is a great place to live. The cost of living, however, is about 2.7 percent higher than the national average, according to Forbes, so in order to make the most of your savings goals, you’ll want to find ways to save money. 
Developing a frugal mindset can have a positive impact on your personal finances. But you don’t have to pinch every penny to get ahead savings goals. Whether you’re trying to build an emergency fund or save up for something special, like a house or vacation, you can develop healthy spending habits to save more. How to Save Money in Sacramento 1. Save on Groceries and Gas With Club Cards 
If you have a lot of mouths to feed at home, checking out at the grocery store can sting. Even if you scratch items off your list and only buy the bare essentials, saving on groceries can be tough. 
While clipping coupons and buying generic saves you money, you might not have time to thumb through newspaper circulars each week in search of deals. Still, you should rarely pay full price on groceries. Pick up loyalty cards at local merchants to earn you discounts while you shop. 
A Safeway store discount card earns you exclusive deals on food and other groceries. You also get discount rates on Safeway gasoline, which can help you spend less at the pump. 
While a grocery list helps you cut down on unnecessary purchases, don’t forget that many grocery chains offer circulars at the store entrance. If you’re stopping by the store for dinner ideas, pick up a circular and shop only from discounted items. 
Read: 5 Simple Ways to Save Money on Your Next Grocery Run 2. Shop at Sacramento Flea Markets for Bargains 
If you’re in the market for a new bed, couch or even new toys, ditch traditional retail stores for flea markets. With better-than-retail prices, The Folsom Boulevard Flea Market can help you save money. With over 450 vendors, this one-stop bargainer’s paradise is great for shopping holiday and birthday gifts. 3. Take Public Transportation Around the City 
If you’re looking to maximize savings, leave your car at home on the weekends — or even during the week work, if possible. The Sacramento Regional Transit District has 67 bus routes and nearly 39 miles of light rail covering 418 squares miles of service area. 
Rather than going on a road trip, opt for a staycation. Make a weekend adventure out of exploring bus routes and enjoying the light rail. 
You can also challenge yourself to use public transportation to get to and from work at least once a week. With the bus and light rail system running year-round, you can save on gas any day. 4. Enjoy Cheap Sacramento Entertainment 
Whether you’re going on a date or taking the kids out for the weekend, you can enjoy Sacramento without digging too deep into your pockets. Every February, Sacramento hosts a free museum day with no-cost entry to 28 local museums. The city’s summer concert series offers free entertainment from May through July. The city also has more than 32 miles of paved bike trails for year-round adventures. 
Deal sites like LivingSocial and Groupon can help you nab Sacramento discounts on all sorts of entertainment options. Save at restaurants, on wine tasting and outdoor excursions. Be careful about buying into too many deals though. You don’t want to buy tickets to an event only to back out at the last minute. 
Read: 101 Ways to Save Money This Summer 5. Compare Rates and Lower Your Energy Bills 
Don’t overlook your monthly utility bills. If you feel like you’re paying too much on utilities, comparison shop Sacramento providers. Take advantage of promotions offered by other cable companies. But before cutting the cord, give your current cable provider a chance to beat competitor rates. 
You can also trim utility bills by switching from incandescent to LED light bulbs. Look into energy-efficient appliances and get into the habit of switching off the lights when you leave a room. Small, energy-saving habits can make paying bills just a little more affordable each month. 6. Save More With a Higher Savings Account Rate 
The national average savings rate is 0.07% APY, according to a semiannual survey conducted by NerdWallet. Compare savings rates offered by local Sacramento banks and credit unions to find competitive account options. Research low-to-no fee accounts, too. The more money you can save on your savings, the more quickly you can build toward financial goals. Community Business Bank of Sacramento and SAFE Credit Union are competitive local options. These financial institutions offer above-average savings account rates, from 0.10% APY to 0.15% APY. 
Read: 7 Crucial Questions to Ask Before Opening a Savings Account 7. Sign Up for Restaurant Freebies and Promotions 
Some restaurants in Sacramento, like Abuelo’s and bd’s Mongolian Grill, will give you free food on your birthday, although you might have to join the restaurant’s email club beforehand. Ask your favorite restaurants about any freebies or promotions. The more promotions you sign up for, the more free meals and discounts you can score. 
As you review your monthly budget, consider how you’re overspending on food, entertainment and bills. See how you can trim costs but be realistic as you reconsider your monthly budget . 
Share This Article
